Package com.example.qrazyqrsrus

Class NotificationSender

java.lang.Object
com.example.qrazyqrsrus.NotificationSender
All Implemented Interfaces:
retrofit2.Callback<MessageSentResponse>
public class NotificationSender extends Object implements retrofit2.Callback<MessageSentResponse>
Manages the sending of notifications through a Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) API. This class utilizes Retrofit to interact with a backend server that communicates with FCM to send push notifications. It supports both direct messages to individual devices and broadcast messages to topics. Adapted from Philipp Lackner's tutorial on sending notifications with Firebase.

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(Boolean isBroadcast, String to, String topic, String eventName, String notificationText, String eventId)
      This function sends the HTTP request to our API that will tell firebase to send a push notification
      Parameters:
      isBroadcast - a boolean that represents whether this message should be broadcast or not
      to - a string that indicates the token of the individual if we are only sending a message to one person. this is only used when sending a milestone update to the organizer
      topic - a string that represents the topic name if we are sending a message to a group of people. this is used when we make new announcements, we send the announcement to the group of users signed up for the event, who are subscribed to the event under the topic labelled with the event document ID
      eventName - a string that represents the title of the notification
      notificationText - a string that represents the body of the notification

    • onResponse

      public void onResponse(retrofit2.Call<MessageSentResponse> call, retrofit2.Response<MessageSentResponse> response)
      Callback method triggered when the Retrofit call to the server succeeds. This method is empty and can be customized to handle response data or perform further actions upon successful notification delivery.
      Specified by:
      onResponse in interface retrofit2.Callback<MessageSentResponse>
      Parameters:
      call - The executed Retrofit call.
      response - The response received from the server.

    • onFailure

      public void onFailure(retrofit2.Call<MessageSentResponse> call, Throwable t)
      Callback method triggered when the Retrofit call to the server fails. This method is empty and can be customized to handle errors or perform cleanup actions upon failure.
      Specified by:
      onFailure in interface retrofit2.Callback<MessageSentResponse>
      Parameters:
      call - The executed Retrofit call.
      t - The throwable that caused the failure.
